entry.title: Ripple Retracts Acquisition Plans for Fortress Trust
entry.summary:
Following the letter of intent to acquire Fortress Trust, Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse announced the company has decided ‚Äúnot to move forward with an outright acquisition.‚Äù Garlinghouse didn‚Äôt cite specific reasons for dropping the deal but said Ripple planned to remain an investor in Fortress.
Garlinghouse Announces Ripple‚Äôs Withdrawal From Fortress Trust Deal
On Thursday, Ripple‚Äôs CEO confirmed the company has shelved its plans to purchase crypto custodian firm Fortress Trust. The Nevada-licensed financial services provider, founded by Scott Purcell, former CEO of the now-defunct crypto custodian Prime Trust, caught Ripple‚Äôs interest in early September 2023. At the time, Garlinghouse expressed Ripple was ‚Äúexcited to bring on this team and its technology to accelerate our business.‚Äù ‚Ä¶

entry.summary:
In a surprising turn of events, Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse announced that the company has decided to abandon its direct acquisition of financial institution Fortress Trust.¬†
The decision marks a significant departure from Ripple‚Äôs earlier intention to acquire the firm, as they had signed a letter of intent just a few weeks ago.¬†

Ripple Changes Course

entry.title: Bitcoin Is an Obvious Choice As Asset Allocators Begin To Shift Towards Better Debasement Hedges, Says Bloomberg Analyst
The Lightning Network Makes Bitcoin Unstoppable: Bitcoin Backstage with David Marcus
entry.summary:
One of the biggest challenges Bitcoin faces is scalability. Transactions can be slow and costly, making mainchain settlement less efficient for everyday transactional use. Enter the Lightning Network, an innovative solution that has the potential to make Bitcoin unstoppable. In the latest episode of Bitcoin Backstage, we explore the concept behind the Lightning Network, its role in Bitcoin's growth, the involvement of David Marcus with LightSpark, and the unstoppable nature of Bitcoin itself.
Understanding the Lightning Network Before we delve into the incredible impact the Lightning Network has had on Bitcoin, it is essential to understand how it works. The Lightning Network is a second-layer, off-chain scaling solution built on top of the Bitcoin blockchain. It addresses the scalability‚Ä¶

entry.title: Is Dogecoin A Topic Of The Past? Social Media Talks At Lowest Since 2020
entry.summary:
Data shows the social dominance of Dogecoin has dropped to the lowest value since 2020, implying that interest in the meme coin has disappeared.
Dogecoin And Other Meme Coins Have Seen Declining Interest Recently
According to data from the on-chain analytics firm Santiment, meme coins have been occupying a smaller part of the trader interest in the cryptocurrency sector recently.
The relevant indicator here is ‚Äúsocial dominance,‚Äù but to understand it, the social volume, a metric that it‚Äôs based on, must be looked at first. The ‚Äúsocial volume‚Äù is basically a measure of the amount of discussion around a given coin that users on the major social media platforms are participating in.
The metric calculates this value by going through a collection of text-based data (assembled by Santime‚Ä¶

entry.title: Coinbase Launches Perpetual Futures Trading for Retail Crypto Traders Outside the US
entry.summary:
Coinbase has received a regulatory stamp of approval to start offering perpetual futures trading to retail crypto traders outside the U.S., opening up access to the $5.5 trillion global derivatives market.
Coinbase Extends Perpetual Futures Trading to Retail Traders Abroad
The Bermuda Monetary Authority (BMA) granted Coinbase International Exchange, the company‚Äôs new non-U.S. exchange, a license last week to extend its futures trading services to retail investors across the world, except residents in the U.S. With the approval, Coinbase is poised to expand its derivatives services to more customers globally through its Coinbase Advanced platform in the coming weeks.
‚ÄúAs the most trusted and safest name in crypto, Coinbase will operate with maximum transparency, employ a robust risk framework, and meet the high-bar regulatory and compliance standards of the BMA,‚Äù the Coinbase announcement said.
The company sees regulatory approval as an opportunity to further its mission of updating the global financial system by providing users around the world with more access to regulated derivatives. The announcement discloses that Coinbase will follow rigorous risk management and compliance standards set by Bermuda regulators.
The move comes as other exchanges face increased regulatory scrutiny in the United States by regulators like the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission. Coinbase said its futures contracts have already seen over $5.5 billion in notional trading volume since launching earlier this year.
The San Francisco-based company said its futures trading services will only be available to eligible retail investors outside the U.S. after passing the company‚Äôs assessment checks. Coinbase said its futures accounts will be backed by usd coin (USDC) reserves and managed by an experienced risk team.
What do you think about Coinbase rolling out perpetual futures after getting BMA approval? Share your thoughts and opinions about this subject in the comments section below.

entry.title: Strategic Competition and Digital Currencies: Insights from Daniel Flatley, Sarah Kreps, Chris Meserole, and Matthew Pines
entry.summary:
In the world of finance, Bitcoin has emerged as a game-changer. This novel virtual form of money has the potential to revolutionize the global economy and transform the way the world conducts transactions. However, as with any disruptive innovation, the intersection of strategic competition and digital currencies raises crucial questions and challenges. To shed light on this complex landscape, we turn to the insights of leading experts: Daniel Flatley, Sarah Kreps, Chris Meserole, and Matthew Pines.
Understanding the Intersection of Strategic Competition and Digital Currencies The central question that arises when considering the relationship between strategic competition and Bitcoin is how these two forces intertwine. What role do digital currencies play in the global economy, and how do‚Ä¶

entry.summary:
Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss, the Co-Founders of Gemini, are under scrutiny over alleged secret withdrawal of $282 million from the now-bankrupt crypto lender, Genesis. This withdrawal occurred just months before the entire crypto firm collapsed, according to a report by the New York Post.
Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss have been grappling with a series of setbacks in recent times, including layoffs and plummeting trading volumes at Gemini. However, the focus changed when over $900 million in Gemini customer deposits were frozen due to the collapse of Genesis, the crypto lending platform that facilitated Gemini Earn, an interest-bearing program.

entry.title: Bank Of Brazil To Introduce Tougher Crypto Regulation After Increased Adoption
entry.summary:
On Wednesday, September 27, Roberto Campos Neto, Brazil‚Äôs central bank governor, announced his intention to tighten crypto regulation. During his speech on Finance and Taxation at a Congress hearing, Campos Neto said virtual assets brokerages should be subject to strict supervision.¬†
Given Brazil‚Äôs significant increase in crypto adoption, the governor emphasized the need to heighten scrutiny on crypto and related activities.
Crypto Adoption Increased By 44%¬†
Brazil has witnessed increased adoption amid a high inflation rate. This could be because most people have resorted to digital assets to hedge against inflation and evade tax. Moreover, many believe demand has shifted from fiat currency to stablecoins‚Äìcryptocurrencies pegged to USD and other real-world assets.¬†

entry.title: Digital Asset Infrastructure as a Success Factor for Financial Institutions
entry.summary: Andy Flury is founder and CEO of Wyden, a company providing institutional trading technology for digital assets. All this leads to institutional adoption being at a significant threshold ‚Äì which makes the decision for the right infrastructure all the more important. This shift aims to increase security and transparency for traders while maintaining the performance of centralized exchanges.

entry.title: India's 1% Crypto Tax Has Been a Nightmare for High-Frequency Traders, Says Shardeum CEO
entry.summary: As India figures out its regulatory approach to the crypto industry, one thing is clear to Shardeum co-founder Nischal Shetty: ‚ÄúIf you're a high-frequency trader, you can't afford to lose a percentage every time you sell,‚Äù he told Decrypt's Andre Beganski at Messari Mainnet in New York. ‚ÄúThat's something that's caused a lot of issues.‚Äù

entry.title: Newly Partnered with Visa, Solana Focuses on Reliability
entry.summary: Solana has improved network reliability through upgrades like Quick and local fee markets. It recently partnered with Visa to allow settling transactions in USDC on Solana. This could enable merchants to receive instant payments and save on credit card processing fees. Stacy Elliott spoke with Austin Federa, Head of Strategy for the Solana Foundation, at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Most Crypto Users Don't Trust Themselves to Keep Their Seed Phrase Safe: Ledger CEO
entry.summary: Decrypt's Stacy Elliott sat down with Ledger CEO Pascal Gauthier to discuss crypto custody post-FTX, and the hardware wallet manufacturer's controversial Ledger Recover service.

entry.title: Crypto Accounting Challenges and Opportunities
entry.summary: As crypto matures, accounting and tax regulations are evolving. Amy Kalnoki of Bitwave explains how her company helps crypto companies properly account for digital assets. She notes the importance of flexibility as new crypto assets emerge and regulations change. Stacy Elliott interviewed her at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Base as a 'Bridge, Not an Island'
entry.summary: Coinbase's Jesse Pollak, creator of layer-2 blockchain Base, says the launch of the network has exceeded expectations, even if plans changed along the way. He believes Arbitrum One will help bring billions onto blockchain by enabling seamless user experiences. Stacy Elliott interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Explosive Growth Ahead for Enterprise Blockchain
entry.summary: Paul Brody drives Ernst & Young (EY) initiatives and investments in blockchain technology across consulting, audit, and tax business lines. He says enterprise blockchain adoption is nearing an inflection point. Brody believes blockchains will one day handle 40 billion transactions daily across industries like automotive and pharma. Stacy Elliott interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Building a Developer-Friendly zkRollup to Scale Ethereum
entry.summary: Daniel Helm, head of Developer Relations at Scroll, discussess how they are building a zkRollup to scale Ethereum transactions and lower fees. He explained their focus on creating a seamless developer experience by maintaining Ethereum's ethos and tooling. Scroll aims to launch their mainnet soon, providing more scalable blockspace for Ethereum developers. Stacy Elliott of Decrypt interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Regulation Threatens U.S. Dominance of Financial Markets, Says CoinRoutes CEO
entry.summary: Dave Weisberger, Co-Founder and CEO of CoinRoutes, argued that excessive regulation in the U.S. threatens to undermine the country's long-standing dominance in global financial markets. He warned that other countries are embracing blockchain and crypto to build more efficient digital markets, which could cause the US to lose its competitive edge and trillions in GDP. Weisberger said CoinRoutes is now focusing more on expanding internationally due to restrictive policies in the U.S. He was interviewed by Andr√© Beganski of Decrypt at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Bitcoin's Narrative Is Shifting Towards Layer-2 Solutions
entry.summary: Rich Rines, original Core DAO contributor and former Coinbase engineer, discusses how the narrative around Bitcoin is shifting in 2023. While Bitcoin remains digital gold, new layer 2 solutions are emerging to unlock more utility and value from the huge amounts of capital stored in Bitcoin. He says these innovations can benefit Bitcoin holders while keeping Bitcoin maximalists happy by building outside the base layer. Andr√© Beganski interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: We Need to Start Thinking About How we Make Crypto Easy to Use: Robinhood Crypto General Manager
entry.summary: Decrypt's Stacy Elliott sat down with Robinhood Crypto general manager Johann Kerbrat at Messari Mainnet 2023, to talk about the trading platform's crypto wallet, onboarding new users through simplicity, and keeping platform fees sustainable.

entry.title: On-Chain Gaming Poised for Mass Adoption
entry.summary: Jack O'Holleran is CEO and co-founder of SKALE Labs. He explains how on-chain gaming is ready for the mainstream after overcoming early challenges like high fees and poor user experience. Companies can now build blockchain games that look and feel like traditional games, and scalability improvements allow games to support hundreds of millions of players without performance issues. He was interviewed by Andr√© Beganski at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: New Blockchains Boom Creates Opportunity and Challenges
entry.summary: Billy Sebell of the XDC Foundation discussed the proliferation of new layer-1 and layer-2 blockchain solutions. While this expands possibilities, he noted projects must still attract users amidst growing competition. Sebell highlighted the benefits of targeting niche use cases and bringing real-world assets on-chain via tokenization. He was interviewed by Andr√© Beganski of Decrypt at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Accessible Self-Custody for Crypto
entry.summary: Dave Lemke is the CFO & CCO at Giddy, creators of a crypto wallet with decentralized private key security. He explains how their solution allows self-custody while still being recoverable. He highlighted increasing demand for self-custody after the FTX collapse. Lemke also touched on upcoming US crypto regulations and Getty's roadmap to simplify staking and other complex processes. Stacy Elliott interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Defi Education Fund Advocates for Responsible Crypto Regulation
entry.summary: Amanda Tuminelli of the Defi Education Fund discusses the need for sensible crypto regulation. She says regulators should work with the industry to understand how protocols work before proposing expansive rules that could stifle innovation. Stacy Elliott of Decrypt interviewed her at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Train Your Own AI-Powered Fighter? Inside AI Arena
entry.summary: What is AI Arena? Decrypt's Kate Irwin dives into the upcoming video game in an interview with the game's founders, AI Arena CEO Brandon Da Silva and COO Wei Xie.

entry.title: DeFi Lenders and Borrowers Are More Cautious Than Ever. Maple Finance's Sidney Powell Explains Why
entry.summary: Sidney Powell, co-founder of DeFi lender Maple Finance, sits down with Decrypt reporter Andr√© Beganski to talk risk management in DeFi and how the crypto lending and borrowing landscape has changed within the last year.

entry.title: Most DeFi Hacks Are Due to ‚ÄòDumb Mistakes,‚Äô Not On-Chain Vulnerabilities: Halborn
entry.summary: ‚ÄúI think as the ecosystem starts to mature, we'll start to see a slowdown of some of the dumb mistakes that a lot of projects are making,‚Äù Halborn COO David Schwed told Decrypt at Messari Mainnet. ‚ÄúThis is a controversial statement, but many hacks are preventable.‚Äù
